answers.answer: If you have jaundice with high bilirubin levels, your eyes can have a yellow tint to the conjuctiva.  The spider vessels may be a sign of dry, irritated eyes, poor health, poor circulation, chronic allergies, smoking, chronic eye irritation, and sometimes it is just the way some people are made.  Please see an ophthalmologist for a complete eye exam.  Try some good artificial tears like theratears in the meantime.

question: I'm a type 2 diabetic with Compensated Liver Cirrhosis.Over the last several months I've noticed changes in the whites of my eyes.I now have what appears to be spider nevi , In the whites of both eyes. This looks different than regular "blood shot eyes"The whites also look different almost a darker cloudy color.Could this be from the cirrhosis and the changes it causes I have many spider nevi on my upper body?Or should I be more concerned about the Diabetes, I have never had a issue with diabetic damage before.Someone I know Eye Dr. stated they could tell by looking at the eye that he had liver damage is this trueGail
title: Veinous changes in whites of the eye
